articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The main opposition Democratic Party has scheduled an impeachment vote for Saturday evening.
articles.title: Ruling party leader says South Korea president must be suspended as soon as possible

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, in an interview broadcast on Thursday, said the use of a hypersonic missile in the Ukraine war sought to make the West understand that Moscow was ready to use any means to ensure no "strategic defeat" would be inflicted on Moscow.
articles.title: Russia's Lavrov signals readiness to use any means in Ukraine conflict

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te urged China on Friday to "unclench its fists" and not take any unilateral actions, saying ahead of expected Chinese war games around the island that Beijing would not win any respect for military drills.
articles.title: Ahead of expected war games, Taiwan urges China to 'unclench its fists'

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: Michel Barnier, a veteran politician who was formerly the European Union's Brexit negotiator, will be the shortest serving prime minister in modern French history.
articles.title: Barnier expected to resign as France's festering political crisis rumbles on

articles.author: Lais Morais
articles.description: When Rebeca Mendes became pregnant, she fought for the right to have an abortion in Brazil. The Supreme Court denied her request to allow it in 2017, so she flew to Colombia to terminate her pregnancy.
articles.title: Brazilian abortion activist had to go abroad to end pregnancy

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: Donor countries have pledged a record $100 billion three-year replenishment of the World Bank's fund for the poorest nations, providing a vital lifeline for their struggles against crushing debts, climate disasters, inflation and conflict.
articles.title: World Bank wins pledges for $100 bln replenishment of fund for poorest countries

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin no longer plans to travel to South Korea, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Thursday, following South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's botched attempt this week to impose martial law.
articles.title: Exclusive: US defense secretary scraps South Korea trip after martial law attempt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 7 earthquake hit off the northern California coast on Thursday, prompting a tsunami warning that was later canceled for a large stretch of the California and Oregon coasts, officials said.
articles.title: Strong quake strikes off California, tsunami warning canceled

articles.author: Kylie Madry, Ted Hesson
articles.description: Mexico is seeking an agreement with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump to ensure it does not receive deportees from third countries in case of large-scale deportations of migrants from the United States, President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Thursday.
articles.title: Mexico seeks deal with Trump to avoid deported migrants from other countries

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila
articles.description: Ghana's two main presidential contenders staged rival rallies in the capital, Accra, on Thursday evening, courting voters in a final push ahead of the world's second biggest cocoa producer's legislative and presidential election set for Saturday.
articles.title: Ghana's presidential frontrunners in last-minute rally for votes
